intro: Cyrtandra poikilophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its diverse leaf shapes and sizes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with tubular corollas that range in color from white to pink. Cyrtandra poikilophylla is an example of the high level of endemism found in Hawaiian flora.
